page.title: 18A NEW SCHOOL IN BLAYDON.
page.content: The new school is to be called St. Joseph's R.C. Primary. It will open in September 1985. It replaces the old school building which was built in 1896. It catered for children aged between five and fifteen, but became an infants and junior school eighteen years ago. The children cme from Blaydon,Winlaton and Swalwell. Today it has 240 juniors and 120 infants. The school is closing because of a lack of facilities. The new school cost Â£500,000 to build, and was built by Gordon Durham. It has a dining hall,library, and a pottery room. It has a paved area with bushes. It can accomodate 300 pupils. On the last day of term all the children will ring the bell on the outside of the building once. The new school will have a mass said every Friday in their hall.
